title: Predicting maintenance of NYC subways
description: Predictive maintenance framework composed of linear and tree-based models to predict most vulnerable lines. Showcased at 2025 NYC Open Data Week

title: IntelliBART database
description: A relational database management system that integrates BART ridership data with GTFS feeds, enabling geospatial and temporal analysis

title: Run clubs in NYC
description: Simple, colorful map of run clubs in NYC for natives
tech_stack2: Python (Web Scrapping w/ BeautifulSoup), HTML, CSS

title: Transit deserts in NYC
description: Visualized NYC subway system's network architecture, namely nodes, flows, and agents to identify dead transit zones
tech_stack2: ArcGIS Pro (Network Analyst Toolkit), ArcGIS StoryMaps

title: MakAR augmented reality application
description: Augmented Reality application for Meta Orion Smart Glasses, designed for use in the MakerLAB at Cornell Tech

title: Resilience IQ
description: Creating UI for Resilience IQ, a web platform on urban adaptaion and climate resilience efforts across 100+ cities
tech_stack2: JavaScript, React.JS, Astro, MapBox GL JS

title: Designing spatial menus in AR
description: Reimagining contextual menus in Augmented Reality (Google's “Augmented Object Intelligence” paper) for improved usability and discoverability

title: Forecasting transit ridership in the Bay Area
description: Answering whether transit ridership will return to pre-pandemic levels
tech_stack2: Time Series Analysis, Python (Scikit-Learn), SARIMA, Prophet

title: Cornell Tech's Urban Tech Hub
description: The Urban Tech Hub at Cornell Tech is an academic think tank developing human-centered technology for urban challenges. I work with professors to design and implement tech solutions for public and private partners. Recent projects include developing tree-planting strategies for extreme heat mitigation and building a global resilience dashboard.

title: NYC AlgoMatcher
description: Helping New Yorkers understand which city algorithms might use their personal data for local decision-making, policymaking, and budgeting

title: Tree-planting strategies in NYC
description: Developed tree-planting strategies to mitigate extreme heat in 5 NYC community districts using geospatial modeling, influencing urban tree planting decision made by New Yorkers for Parks NGO

title: Classifying natural disaster Tweets using natural language processing
description: Built robust preprocessing pipeline (stopword removal, lemmatization, and vectorization) and feature extraction models (Bag of Words and N-Grams) to classify tweets as disaster-related or not.

title: Cornell's TechTakes App
description: Developed hi-fidelity prototype for Cornell Tech students to rate, review, and discuss courses and professors

title: Prototyping Trailmates hiking app
description: Developed hi-fidelity prototype across mobile, desktop, and smartwatch interfaces for users to discover, plan, and share hikes through filters, social features, and a community feed

title: Designing interactions in VR
description: Improved a VR architectural scene by implementing navigation, teleportation, snap turning interaction techniques using XR Interaction Toolkit in Unity for Meta Quest 2

title: Tata Consultancy Services
description: Developing AWS QuickSight app with ML analytics to drive real-time, data-driven decision-making for an Insurtech client

title: CSAA Insurance Group, an AAA Insurer
description: As one of two product analysts on team, I was responsible for Personal Lines Auto and Property Insurance in AZ, NV, and UT. I forecasted the 3-year financial plan; improved geographic risk segmentation in the pricing algorithm; delivered monthly performance updates to the senior leadership; and supported the migration of data assets from SAS to the cloud-based Snowflake platform.
tech_stack2: SQL, Snowflake, Oracle Essbase, Microsoft Suite, Tableau

title: User-centered analysis of transit apps
description: Exploring how student commuters use transit apps like MTA’s official app, Google Maps, and Apple Maps to navigate NYC public transportation through different modes of inquiry (semi-structured qualitative interviews, contextual inquiries, and surveys)

title: CSAA Insurance Group, an AAA Insurer
description: Created a business proposal for specialized Electric Vehicle insurance using Porter’s Five Forces, collaborating with actuaries and product specialists to assess market fit in California. Pitched proposal to senior leadership, earning recognition for rigorous roadmap and cross-functional collaboration

title: ESRI
description: Helped run event logistics and got to learn about emerging GIS, AI, and LLM tools at Esri Developer and Technology Summit and Esri User Conference

title: CSAA Insurance Group, an AAA Insurer
description: Formulated the company’s competitive positioning across six market profiles and 53 competitors in Maryland's auto insurance market

title: Virtualization of the public sphere
description: Investigated fragmentation of the public sphere following the user exodus from Twitter/X to Bluesky after the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election and assessed how platform design and moderation influence democratic discourse

title: Project Manager @ Microfinance at Berkeley
description: Led a team of four to help two small businesses in Berkeley build their e-commerce presence

title: UC Berkeley's Essig Museum of Entomology
description: Co-digitized Elwood Zimmerman's seven multivolume series on Hawaiian insect taxonomy into a database for faster retrieval as part of my undergraduate research

title: Impact of heterogenous quarantine mandates on COVID-19 cases in the US
description: Estimated the effects of strict quarantine mandates across six intervention windows and 3,143 U.S. counties

title: Does the Environmental Kuznets Curve Hold? An Empirical Examination
description: Verified the Environmental Kuznets Curve using OLS regression on panel data from 161 countries in R; addressed endogeneity and omitted variable bias via fixed effects and instrumental variables, finding empirical support for a parabolic income–pollution relationship.

title: Recognizing handwritten digits using Gaussian classifiers
description: Built a Gaussian classifier in SciPy and Scikit-learn to recognize handwritten digits from MNIST by applying Linear Discriminant Analysis for dimensionality reduction and modeling class-conditional pixel distributions via maximum likelihood estimation

title: Classiyging images using Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)
description: Built a convolutional neural network to classify images from the CIFAR-10 dataset using PyTorch and TensorFlow

title: Managing files using local version control system
description: Built a version control system in Java to manage local repositories, track file history, and enable restoration

title: Recreating 2048 Game
description: Implemented the core game logic for a fully functional 2048 clone in Java

title: 2D Tile-Based World Exploration Game
description: Co-built a 2D tile-based game in Java that allowed users to explore and interact with objects in pseudorandomly generated worlds

title: How does disinformation spread?
description: Designed a bilingual survey experiment in English and Hindi as part of a PhD student’s research on misinformation and Bayesian belief updating

title: Assessing the impact of foreign student migration on US innovation output
description: Conducted a Difference-in-Differences analysis to assess the impact of foreign student migration on U.S. patenting with evolving U.S. student visa programs (F-1, OPT-STEM, H1-B) and authored white paper
